forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 14 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 57. South southeast wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds under a blanket of dense clouds, bearing the weight of impending rain. The air, laden with moisture and the palpable chill of the south-southeast breeze, carries whispers of an 80% chance of precipitation. As the day wears on, temperatures slide downwards, resting just shy of 60 degrees. The view is shrouded, with visibility diminished, making the iconic landmarks appear more like shadowy ghosts than vibrant beacons. 

Tonight promises to swell with the rhythm of rain, an unwavering 100% chance ensuring that the streets will glisten with fresh droplets. As the temperatures dip to a low of around 57, gusts may swirl about with a strength of 35 mph, adding a brisk edge to the evening. It’s a time to embrace comfort; layering with a warm jacket and waterproof boots is wise. As for activities, the allure of a cozy café with a steaming cup of coffee or tea feels particularly inviting, offering a retreat from the dampness. One might also indulge in the embrace of a local bookstore, where the warmth and quietude provide a perfect escape as the storm descends.
